options.label: Door/Window Sensor or external alarm sensor

2.label: DOOR/WINDOW/ALARM
2.description:
Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. 
				If you connect the alarm sensor, it determines the output type. 
				Parameter inactive in Switch Mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

3.label: Visual LED indications
3.description:
This parameter defines events indicated by the visual LED indicator. 
				Disabling events might extend battery life.
				0 - no indications
				1 - indication of opening/closing status change (input IN)
				2 - indication of wake up (1 x click or periodical)
				4 - indication of device tampering

4.label: Range test after double click
4.description:
Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. 
				If you connect the alarm sensor, it determines the output type. 
				Parameter inactive in Switch Mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

10.label: 2nd association group triggers
10.description:
Parameter defines events which result in sending on/off commands to devices added to the 2nd association group. 
				These commands are sent alternately to switch the devices on and off. 
				Commands represent the values of BASIC SET command frames. 
				Parameter is inactive in external button mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

11.label: Commands sent to 2nd association group
11.description: Command frames sent to devices added to the 2nd association group.

12.label: Value of ON command frame sent to 2nd association group
12.description:
The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. 
				In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.

13.label: Value of OFF command frame sent to 2nd association group
13.description:
The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. 
				In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.

14.label: Time delay of ON command frame
14.description: Time period after which ON command frame will be sent.

15.label: Time delay of OFF command frame
15.description: Time period after which OFF command frame will be sent.

20.label: Type of sent alarm frames
20.description:
Type of control frames transmitted to the main controller and 3rd association group Alarm. 
				If an external sensor is connected to IN input, it is possible to choose its functionality. 
				Otherwise it is recommended to set this parameter to default value.

30.label: Delay of tamper alarm cancellation
30.description: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.

31.label: Reporting tamper alarm cancellation
31.description: Reporting cancellation of tamper alarm to the controller and 5th association group.

options.label: Do not send tamper cancellation report

50.label: Interval of temperature measurements
50.description:
This parameter defines how often the temperature will be measured. 
				The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten.	
				0 - temperature measurements disabled
				5-32400 - time in seconds

51.label: Temperature reports threshold
51.description:
This parameter defines the change of temperature in comparison with last reported, resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller.
				0 - temperature reports based on threshold disabled
				1-300 - temperature threshold (0.1-30C, 0.1C step)

52.label: Interval of temperature reports
52.description:
This parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.
				0 - periodic temperature reports disabled
				5-32400 - time in seconds

53.label: Temperature offset
53.description: The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation). (0,1C steps)

54.label: Temperature alarm reports
54.description:
Temperature alarms reported to the Z-Wave controller. 
				Thresholds are set in parameters 55 and 56.

55.label: High temperature alarm threshold
55.description:
If temperature is higher than set value, overheat notification will be sent and high temperature scene will be triggered (if activated).
				0-1000 (0-100C, 0.1C step).

56.label: Low temperature alarm threshold
56.description:
If temperature is lower than the set value, underheat notification will be sent and low temperature scene will be triggered (if activated).
				300-700 (-30-70C, 0.1C step)

70.label: Scene activation functionality
70.description:
The device can trigger scenes using scene IDs assigned to different events.
				To deactivate all scenes set the value to 0. 
				To activate all scenes set the value to 3903.
				1    - [ID 10] opening door/window (single click).
				2    - [ID 11] closing door/window (single click).
				4    - [ID 12] holding.
				8    - [ID 13] releasing.
				16   - [ID 14] double click.
				32   - [ID 15] triple click.
				256  - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window opened.
				512  - [ID 50] high temperature - door/window closed.
				1024 - [ID 51] low temperature  - door/window opened.
				2048 - [ID 51] low temperature  - door/window closed.

71.label: Alarm broadcast
71.description:
Settings for broadcasting ON/OFF commands, sensor alarm and tamper alarm. 
				Value other than 0 means alarms are sent in Broadcast Mode, to all devices only within the range of the device. 
				They are not repeated by the mesh network.
			0 - broadcasts inactive.
			1 - ON/OFF commands broadcast active.
			2 - sensor alarm broadcast active.
			4 - tamper alarm broadcast active.

72.label: Associations in Z-Wave network Security Mode
72.description:
This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. 
				Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st group Lifeline
			0 - none of the groups sent as secure.
			1 - 2nd group Control sent as secure.
			2 - 3rd group Alarm sent as secure.
			4 - 4th group Sensor ZW3 sent as secure.
			8 - 5th group Tamper ZW3 sent as secure.
